author: Tom Fairless
title: ECB’s German Skew Raises Questions Over Draghi’s Successor - WSJ
text:
FRANKFURT—Germany’s outsize influence at the European Central Bank is raising concerns among some eurozone officials and banking executives ahead of a decision over whether to name a German to lead the institution for the first time.
The ECB, based here in Germany’s financial capital, has more German nationals on its staff than French, Italians and Spanish combined, according to new data that could heighten concerns over German dominance of the European Union’s most important institutions. Of roughly 2,900 ECB staff on permanent...
